Subject: Making ETags mandatory

Hi,

while working on our new RESTful web service and discovering the need =
for versioning (mainly preventing concurrent changes) I wondered whether it=
 was acceptable to make ETags (i.e. presence of an If-Match header for PUT,=
 DELETE and maybe POST where applicable) mandatory.
In RFC 2616 I could not=
 find any evidence that this allowed or forbidden. But I might have overloo=
ked it.
If you consider it acceptable: which status code would you return t=
o a client that did not provide an appropriate header? Well certainly one o=
f the 4xx errors, but I'm not sure which to choose in particular.


Regards=
,
Julian Reich
